hadiths.english_translation: Multiple chains reporting that the Prophet ﷺ said: 'If you were as you are with me (always), the angels would greet you with their wings.' Also contains an incident about Adi ibn Hatim, Jarir ibn Abdullah, and Hanẓalah (the Prophet's ﷺ scribe) leaving Kufa because the Uthman ibn Affan was being cursed there.

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Qatadah is a known mudallis (Category 3) reporting using 'an ('ala al-Jumhur), which may indicate indirect transmission

potential_issues.impact: Two chains contain Qatadah reporting using 'an (عَنْ), which may indicate hidden intermediaries. However, Qatadah's reliability with his known teachers is generally acceptable. This affects the certainty of the chain but doesn't completely invalidate it.

potential_issues.issue: Ghassan ibn Burzin is a majhul (unknown) narrator
potential_issues.impact: Fourth chain is weakened due to the presence of Ghassan ibn Burzin who is majhul. This chain has limited reliability.

potential_issues.issue: Multiple transmission paths with varying levels of reliability
potential_issues.impact: The hadith is supported by multiple chains, but quality varies significantly. First chain is mawquf about an incident, while remaining chains report the main saying marfu'. This provides some corroboration but with reservations.

Topics: Incident of Adi ibn Hatim, Jarir ibn Abdullah, and Hanẓalah leaving Kufa due to cursing of Uthman ibn Affan
Saying of the Prophet ﷺ about angels greeting companions

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Hanẓalah ibn Hunayfa ibn Hudhayim: His father Hudhayim said, 'O Messenger of Allah, I am an old man and this is my youngest son, so ask Allah to bless him.' The Prophet ﷺ said, 'Come here, young boy,' and he took my hand and stroked my head and said, 'May Allah bless you,' or 'You are blessed.' Hanẓalah would have people brought to him who had swelling, and he would place his hand (on them) and say, 'In the name of Allah,' and the swelling would go away.

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Ya'qub ibn Ishaq only reports this hadith, making him problematic as he is saduq at best
Hanẓalah ibn Hunayfa is majhul (unknown) - no other narrators appear to be familiar with him
Hudhayim's reliability is unknown (majhul al-hal), though he appears to be a companion

potential_issues.issue: Ya'qub ibn Ishaq is a saduq narrator with limited transmission
potential_issues.impact: Ya'qub ibn Ishaq is not of the highest reliability grade, which affects the overall chain authenticity
This is a critical weakness - Hanẓalah ibn Hunayfa is unknown and appears in no other chain, making him a single-source narrator (majhul al-'ayn potential)
Although Hudhayim may be a companion, his reliability and credibility are not documented in hadith science literature

Topics: Incident of a father asking the Prophet ﷺ to bless his young son
Blessing and supplication of the Prophet ﷺ
Healing through invocation of Allah's name

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Jubaylah ibn Suhayim: I prayed behind Hanẓalah al-Ansari, an imam of the mosque of Quba' from the companions of the Prophet ﷺ, and he recited Surat Maryam (Chapter 19 of the Quran) in the first rak'ah (unit of prayer).

chainIssues: Yahya ibn Yusuf is majhul (unknown) narrator

potential_issues.issue: Multiple majhul (unknown) narrators in the chain

These narrators appear to have minimal transmission records, raising questions about their credibility

Topics: Incident of prayer behind Hanẓalah al-Ansari at Quba' mosque

hadiths.english_translation: This is a biographical note indicating that Ibn Mas'ud's saying was reported by Masur and Khalid ibn Abd Allah from Abu Sinan from Ibn Abi al-Hudhail. Shu'bah mentioned Suwayd ibn Hanẓalah, and Ibn Abi al-Aswad narrated from Ibn Mahdi that Sufyan asked about Shu'bah, from Abu Sinan from Suwayd ibn Hanẓalah, saying, 'Who is Suwayd?' The answer was, 'He is Abdullah ibn Hanẓalah.'

hadiths.english_translation: This is a biographical note about Hanẓalah Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Sudusi, a Basran narrator from the circle of Anas and Shahr. Multiple narrators transmitted from him including Hammad ibn Zayd, Jarir ibn Hazm, and Hisham ibn Hassan. Ibn al-Mubarak classified him. Yahya al-Qattan said about him, 'I have seen him and deliberately abandoned him because he suffered from ikhtilat (confusion).' According to another chain via Ishaq: Abd al-Samad narrated, 'I heard my father, Hanẓalah Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Sudusi narrated to us.' Abu Mu'awiyah mentioned Hanẓalah ibn Abi Safiyyah, and Ibrahim ibn Tahman corroborated this.
